content:
As it is showing the "selected" email I think you are asking how to not move the selected message to the next message in the list after you delete. Is that the case?

Why would you even enable that column unless you have a disability that makes selecting an email with a mouse of keyboard difficult?
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I didn't know there was an option to enable/disable that column. How do you disable the "select all messages" column?

"Shift" and click works fine for me to delete multiple messages.
creator: jim109

content:
On the right of the line of column headings is a little square looking widget. Click it to customize what is shown in the way of columns.

The select message is the first on the menu.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Akým protokolom pristupujete k pošte? POP, alebo IMAP?

Ak protokolom POP tak tu je postup: 1. Vytvortete si v "Lokálne priečinky" nejaký priečinok, napríklad s názvom "Odpadkový kôš". http://imgbank.cz/images/2014/06/29/Bez_nazvuhs4e7.jpg 2. Vypnite Thunderbird. 3. Pozrite sa do profilu Thunderbirdu ...\Profiles\ghpt46pi.default\Mail\Local Folders\ a preverte, či tam existuje súbor Trash (bez prípony). Ak neexistuje (odstránili ste ho), tak ho v tom priečinku vytvorte (bez prípony). 4. Spustite Thunderbird a kliknite na novo vytvorený priečinok s názvom "Odpadkový kôš" pravým tlačidlom myši a zvolte "Vlastnosti". Nastavte SPRÁVNU cestu do profilu Thunderbirdu až k tomu súboru Trash: ...\Profiles\ghpt46pi.default\Mail\Local Folders\Trash - a uložte tieto nastavenia stlačením tlačidla OK. http://imgbank.cz/images/2014/06/29/Thunderbird_odpodkovy_kos.jpg 5. Vypnite Thunderbird. Spustite Thunderbird. A už by to malo fungovať ako za mlada.
creator: Ansamb

content: This is not a Thunderbird issue. The error you are receiving is a security check enforced by Gmail, but not uniformly by others. So, while you may be able to email other email providers, you cannot send to Gmail addresses. The error is that your domain name is not properly documented as being identified with the IP address you are using. You need to work with your domain registrar and/or your email host provider to resolve this.
creator: davidsk

content: This is a duplicate of https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1448392 please keep within the original thread to ensure that volunteers helping you will see the full history. Thanks.

content:
Just a couple of points.

1. This is a peer support forum. You are not communicating here with anyone but your fellow Thunderbird users. There is a feedback link on the help menu in Thunderbird where you can feedback your feelings to the development team.

2. You have already said you do not care what I think. So I will not even try and help.

But I will point out to you that Thunderbird does not act as if it has a link and make it clickable until you save the message as a draft and open it again, or you click send. This is unlike Microsoft product which immediately treat the link as such and make editing require the use of arcane keystrokes on the text, let alone the actual link.

As you dismissed what I had to say out of hand I guess we still do not know if doing so resolves what you are expecting to have happen V's what is happening. I wish you all the luck in the world with your new mail program. I have a feeling you will need it.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: - highlight account on main pane - rightclick and select 'settings' - look down LEFT side to 'Account Actions' and click there - in drop-down menu, select 'remove account'

content: I believe the issue is simple, at least, mostly so. You can create archives in Local Folders and doing that will remove archived messages off the server, no longer counted toward quota.
